Package net.xqhs.flash.core

Interface Loader<T extends Entity<?>>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of Entity instance that the loader can load.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CompositeAgentLoader, Loader.SimpleLoader, NodeLoader
    public interface Loader<T extends Entity<?>>
    A loader instance has the capability of creating new Entity instances.

    Entities are created based on a configuration that is loaded at boot time and is represented as a MultiTreeMap.

    For many types of entities the loader may not be necessary. If instantiating the class if sufficient, Loader.SimpleLoader may be used.

    Author:
    andreiolaru

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  Loader.SearchItemType
      Type of item to be searched for by autoFind methods.
      static class  Loader.SimpleLoader
      Simple implementation for Loader, which attempts to load the entity class by instantiating it: using a constructor that receives a MultiTreeMap as argument, or using the default constructor, and if the instance implements ConfigurableEntity, subsequently calling ConfigurableEntity.configure(net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap).

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        boolean configure​(MultiTreeMap configuration,
                  net.xqhs.util.logging.Logger log,
                  ClassFactory classLoader)
        Configures an instance of the loader based on deployment data.
        Parameters:
        configuration - - the deployment data.
        log - - a Logger instance to use for logging messages, during the loader's activity.
        classLoader - - a ClassFactory instance to use to load classes.
        Returns:
        true if the configuration process was successful and the Loader instance is ready to load entities; false if this instance cannot be expected to work normally.

      • preload

        boolean preload​(MultiTreeMap configuration,
                java.util.List<Entity.EntityProxy<? extends Entity<?>>> context)
        Same as preload(MultiTreeMap), but performs the checks in the given context.
        Parameters:
        configuration - - the configuration data for the entity.
        context - - the entities that form the context of the entity to be loaded. The argument may be null or empty.
        Returns:
        true if load(net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap, java.util.List<net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<? extends net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity<?>>>, java.util.List<net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap>)ing the entity is expected to complete successfully; false if the entity cannot load with the given configuration.
        See Also:
        preload(MultiTreeMap)

      • preload

        boolean preload​(MultiTreeMap configuration)
        Performs checks and completes the configuration.

        This method may be implemented by implementing classes in order to

        • Check that an Entity of type T and with the given configuration can indeed be loaded; it this method returns true, then calling load(net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap, java.util.List<net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<? extends net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity<?>>>, java.util.List<net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap>) with the same configuration is expected to complete successfully.
        • Add new elements to the given configuration so as to improve the subsequent performance of a call to load(net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap, java.util.List<net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<? extends net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity<?>>>, java.util.List<net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap>) with the same configuration.
        Depending on each specific Loader implementation, the call to preload(net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap, java.util.List<net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<? extends net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity<?>>>) may be optional or mandatory, but it is recommended that load(net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap, java.util.List<net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<? extends net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity<?>>>, java.util.List<net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap>) checks if the configuration has been pre-loaded and, if not, to call preload(net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap, java.util.List<net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<? extends net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity<?>>>).
        Parameters:
        configuration - - the configuration of the entity that one intends to load. This COnfiguration may be modified (added to) in this method.
        Returns:
        true if load(net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap, java.util.List<net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<? extends net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity<?>>>, java.util.List<net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap>)ing the entity is expected to complete successfully; false if the entity cannot load with the given configuration.

      • load

        T load​(MultiTreeMap configuration,
       java.util.List<Entity.EntityProxy<? extends Entity<?>>> context,
       java.util.List<MultiTreeMap> subordinateEntities)
        Loads a new instance of entity T and provides it with the given context, as well as with a flat (as opposed to the hierarchical structure provided by the configuration) list of entities that should be present in the context of this entity. The list is expected to be formed similarly to the result of DeploymentConfiguration.getEntityList() and to be able to be processed using DeploymentConfiguration.filterContext(List, String) and DeploymentConfiguration.filterCategoryInContext(List, String, String). Both the configuration and the subordinateEntities list should contain references to the same MultiTreeMap instances.

        Note that some of the subordinate entities in the configuration and the subordinateEntities list may contain the attribute DeploymentConfiguration.LOADED_ATTRIBUTE_NAME, indicating that the entity has already been loaded and does not need to be loaded anymore.

        Parameters:
        configuration - - the configuration data for the entity.
        context - - the entities that form the context of the loaded entity. The argument may be null or empty.
        subordinateEntities - - a flat list of entities that should be loaded inside the loaded entity. This may be null.
        Returns:
        the entity, if loading has been successful.

      • load

        T load​(MultiTreeMap configuration)
        Loads a new instance of entity T, without providing it with any context.

        See also load(MultiTreeMap, List, List).

        Parameters:
        configuration - - the configuration data for the entity.
        Returns:
        the entity, if loading has been successful.

      • autoFind

        static java.lang.String autoFind​(ClassFactory factory,
                                 java.util.List<java.lang.String> packages,
                                 java.lang.String given_cp,
                                 java.lang.String upper_name,
                                 java.lang.String lower_name,
                                 java.lang.String entity,
                                 java.util.List<java.lang.String> checkedPaths)
        Attempts to find a specific class given some known information about it. Among this information there are 3 conceptual elements:
        • the type of the entity or similar concept (e.g. agent, pylon, loader etc); usually it is the last word in the class name, e.g. CompositeAgent, SimpleAgentLoader, etc;
        • the "upper" name -- the kind of the entity, and normally it should be given (it should not be null); e.g. composite (for agents), local or websocket (for pylons), etc;
        • the "lower" name -- a more specific name, which may be omitted (can be null); e.g. in SequentialCompositeAgent;
        The method searches the class in the following sequence:
        • verify directly the given classpath (given_cp)
        • verify if the given classpath can be found in any of the packages
        • verify all combinations of three elements -- the base package, a specific subtree, and the classpath, where:
          • the base package is one of DeploymentConfiguration.ROOT_PACKAGE, DeploymentConfiguration.CORE_PACKAGE, and any of the given packages.
          • the subtree is a classpath segment formed as one of the following (e.g. the base package and for the sequential-composite-agent lower-upper-entity search case):
            • the upper name -- e.g. base.composite.
            • the upper name and the lower name -- e.g. base.composite.sequential.
            • the lower name and the upper name -- e.g. base.sequential.composite.
            • the lower name -- e.g. base.sequential.
          • the classpath is any camel-case rendition of the following combination (e.g. for the sequential-composite-agent lower-upper-entity search case):
            • upper name and entity -- e.g. CompositeAgent
            • lower name and entity -- e.g. SequentialAgent
            • lower name, upper name, and entity -- e.g. SequentialCompositeAgent

          TODO: example

        Parameters:
        factory - - the ClassFactory that can test if the class exists / can be loaded.
        packages - - a list of java packages in which to search.
        given_cp - - a classpath or a class name that may be given directly, saving the effort of searching for the class. This classpath will also be searched in the list of packages.
        upper_name - - the upper name in the kind hierarchy of the entity (should not be null if the given_cp is null).
        lower_name - - the upper name in the kind hierarchy of the entity (can be null).
        entity - - the name of the entity for which a class is searched (should not be null).
        checkedPaths - - a List in which all checked paths will be added (checked paths are classpaths where the class have been searched).
        Returns:
        the full classpath of the first class that has been found, if any; null otherwise.

      • autoFind

        static java.lang.String autoFind​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> packages,
                                 java.lang.String given_cp,
                                 java.lang.String upper_name,
                                 java.lang.String lower_name,
                                 java.lang.String entity,
                                 java.util.List<java.lang.String> checkedPaths)
        Same as autoFind(ClassFactory, List, String, String, String, String, List), but searching for files instead of classes. The workings are the same, except that in the package names dots are substituted by slashes. The checkedPaths and the method return value also use slashes.
        Parameters:
        packages -
        given_cp -
        upper_name -
        lower_name -
        entity -
        checkedPaths -
        Returns:
        the path to the first file found, if any; null otherwise.
        See Also:
        TODO: upper_name, lower_name and entity don't work in a meaningful way and are assambled by capitalization of the names. The Todo is to change the manner of assembly when searching for files and assemble via underscores.

      • loadCheck

        private static boolean loadCheck​(java.lang.String path,
                                 Loader.SearchItemType searchType,
                                 java.lang.Object... objects)
        Checks if a Loader.SearchItemType item can be found.
        Parameters:
        path - - the path to check.
        searchType - - the type of item.
        objects - - other relevant objects. Currently in use is the ClassFactory instance to use for searching for classes.
        Returns:
        true if the item is found / can be loaded.

        upper_name -

        searchType -
        others -
